title: Vu Premium 164 cm (65 inch) Ultra HD (4K) LED Smart Android TV  (65PM)

product_specification.In The Box: Power cable, Remote control, battery, user Manual, Table & Wall mount stand.
product_specification.Wi-Fi Type: IEEE 802.11 a, b, g, n, ac, 2.4 GHz / 5.0 GHz
product_specification.Digital TV Reception: Television Standard in VHF Band / UHF Band: DVB - T / T2
product_specification.Supported Video Formats: MPEG1, MPEG2, MPEG4, H.263, H.264, H.265, AVS, MVC, VP8, VP9
product_specification.Sound Technology: Dolby Digital Plus, DTS Virtual-X Surround Sound, Dolby Audio
product_specification.Surround Sound: DTS Virtual-X Surround Sound, TruBass HDX, TruSurround X, Dialog Clarity
product_specification.Sound Mode: Standard, Theater, Sports, Music, Speech, Late Night
product_specification.Other Remote Control Features: Voice Search, Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube, Hotstar and Google Play Hotkeys on Remote, Smart Remote, Remote Controller Technology: IR/1
product_specification.Other Convenience Features: Power Off if No Signal, Program Lock, Software Version OSD Indication, Favorite Channels List, Time Shift
product_specification.Stand Type: Wall Mount and Table Top Stand
product_specification.Other Dimensions: VESA Wall Mount Dimensions (Horizontal / Vertical): 300 X 200 mm
product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Warranty of the Product is Limited to Manufacturing Defects Only. Parts and Labor Costs are Covered
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: The Product is Not Used According to Instructions Given in the Instruction Manual, Defects Caused By Improper Use as Determined by the Company Personnel, Modification or Alteration of Any Nature is Made in the Electrical Circuitry/or Physical Construction of the Set, Installation/ Repair Work is Carried Out by Persons/Agency Other Than Authorized by the Company, Site (premises Where the Product is Kept) Conditions That Do Not Confirm to the Recommended Operating Conditions of the Machine, Original Serial Number is Removed, Obliterated or Altered From the Machine or Cabinet, Defects Due to Cause Beyond Control Like Lightning, Abnormal Voltage, Acts of God or While in Transit to Service Centre or Purchaser's Residence, The Warranty Does Not Cover Any External Accessories (such As Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag Etc.), Mentioned in The Operating Instruction Manual Supplied With This Product or Any Cosmetic Parts.
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: We'll facilitate the installation and demo through authorized service engineer at your convenience. The installation will be done within 48 hours of delivery of the TV. The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. Installation and demo are provided free of cost. The engineer will also help you understand your new TV's features. The process generally covers: Wall-mounted or table-top installation, as requested. Physical check of all ports, including power and USB ports. Accessories also checked. Demonstration of features and settings Quick run-through on how to operate the TV

product_description.Bright Visuals: This Vu TV features a special optical film to control the amount of light that enters through the backlight LEDs. As a result, it enhances the viewing angle with wide reflection. The improved light reflection enhances the brightness with white balance accuracy. So, you get to enjoy stunning visuals on this TV that features 400 nits brightness.
product_description.Panoramic Viewing: The panoramic wide viewing angle technique of this TV lets you enjoy clear visuals from different angles of your couch.

review:
This is my first Smart TV and probably first detailed review ever.

I bought this TV after a long research and hesitations. I was worried about my TV experience in low budget and I cannot afford LG, SONY and SAMSUNG high end TVs. Low Budget segments from these makes are not upto the mark as per my research. So competition was between either Mi or Vu. Don't compare this TV with QLEDs and OLEDs. They are high quality brand Tvs which require deep pockets too. I, Like many other thought Vu is Chinese brand but I found out an Indian Lady (Devita Saraf) is founder and CEO. I am sure many parts may have been produced in China or elsewhere but still company is Indian and thankfully the TV quality is also very good. I compared it with Mi TV 4 on many reviews and found out that its nose ahead with it.

PROS:

1) DISPLAY : I thought VA panel may not be as good as IPS but display is very good. Much better than Mi TVs which I have seen personally in many locations. Colors are bright, sharp and vivid. Plus it has VOD Upscaler that means SD channels are looking a bit better then other TVs.
2) ANDROID: System is running smoothly with Android Pie which many told its not the case but in this TV I found out its very good.
3) BUILD-QUALITY: This is my first big smart TV so I haven't seen other very closely but build quality looks good.
4) REMOTE: Remote works really fine.
5) COST: BEST part is the cost. No other TV will give me these much feature and quality at this cost.

CONS:
1) AUDIO: I wont say its bad but its average audio output. Thinking of attaching it with my speakers.
2) SOAP OPERA EFFECT: Most apps doesn't have it but I found out JIO Cinema is showing movies in Soap Opera Effects. I am not able to find how to switch off the effects. May be its in App. Don't know.

All in all I am very happy with the purchase as for people like me its a big decision. I thank you Devita Saraf.

Update 1 : Few days of Usage.

1. Value for money. Hits above it's price bracket.
2. Fast (2GB Ram), have good internal memory at 16GB.
3. Happy with the sound quality, it gets loud if you have right audio settings. ( Refer Tech Singh YouTube video)
4. Tv display is bit flimsy while holding the tv for mounting, but it may be because it is large at 55 Inch.
5. I sit 8 feet away from my tv and it feels large, like a theatre in here, not sure if that is a good thing for eyes, let's wait and see.

More updates will come as I use it more.

Great value for money.
Pros-
4k display is good, pictures look stunning.

Slim bezels and overall premium appearance.

Android tv features are all cool.

30 watt sound was better than anticipated. Sound bar wasn't necessary.

Bluetooth+IR remote is really good.

Headphone jack and Bluetooth functionality is nice.

Lot of picture settings to tweak with to get perfect picture quality that suits individual preference.

Google assistant works great.

Cons-
While VA panel is supposed to produce better blacks than ips, i didn't really notice good black levels.

Viewing from an angle wasn't as good(i guess, not sure).

Some wierd light bleeding-like effects and some dark patches on edges of display especially noticable on YouTube app intro icon/animation. Only visible on frames with low brightness. (Most people wouldn't notice or care).

Nitpicks-
Bluetooth headphone connectivity is gimmicky. Audio only works on hdmi inputs and apps. Doesn't work on usb input, which is frustrating.(edit:- Disconnecting the AUX audio out cable solved the issue with bluetooth audio errors. but there is some audio latency for hdmi input sources while playing through bluetooth.)

Connecting to Bluetooth headset while headphone jack is bieng used by sound bar is really hard. Options for switching audio to Bluetooth headset-only from audio jack is buried deep inside audio settings menu.(edit:- here also disconnecting audio AUX cable solved the issue)

Starting time of tv is a bit high. Around 1 minute. Doesn't automatically play live tv/set-up box input after turning on the tv. You have to select input source each time you turn on the tv. Default input is Android home screen. old people wouldn't be able to watch on their own

Android home screen interface is not always smooth.

8k videos are not at all playable. Video just freezes. Tv cannot handle 8k resolution like some qhd smartphones do.

Didn't notice any 4k upscaling of HD channels or SD channels.

Great product at the price....
Operating is simple and remote is Bluetooth connected (no IR Sensor) which I liked it very much. Google assistant voice commands make it easy for operating. Bluetooth earphones can be connected. Inbuilt chrome cast & Phone mirroring works like charm. Picture quality is great.
Speakers : it is more than enough for 30 feet Hall.
Definitely worth every rupee...
Review based on one week usage.

So got delivered just in 2 days. Awesome picture quality. 4k videos lagging for sometime. 2gb ram seems quite good. But design is super cool. Built quality is superior . In the end value for money . Go for it. WiFi connectivity is really fast. Lest wait for a week. I will update .

After using 10 days , I am writing a review for this television.

Pros :
1. Picture quality is best ,you can't get this quality at this price in any other brand.
2. Performance is great. Tv responds quite fast, no lag so far.
3. Sound is amazing, only 25% volume is enough to listen. True surround X feature works great.
4. Features such as picture setting and sound setting works fine too.
5. Prime, Netflix, hotstar n all apps are working fine. Just Jio Tv doesn't work( Need mouse for toggling)
6. Android ver. Supports sideloads apps too.
7. Casting smoothly works everytime.

Cons:

1. Predefined Picture modes aren't good in picture settings.For eg. No mode for "eye protect"
2.Fast motion in video gives you a headache , it's should've been more still. You can't read television running promoter.


After usage of 2 months, voice command button stopped working on Remote and they said remote is not covered in warranty.

I bought this TV for PS 4 Gaming which i thought. Would provide me a great gaming experiance as expected the TV picture quality is great and sound clarity is also great. Good TV for less Budget. Awesum from VU
Excellent TV. I am writing this review to help others for the correct choice..It has awesome picture quality and sound. Internet connectivity is good. Non HD channels quality also good.

Really after a long time I brought a Vu TV this is my first TV I never seen such a TV like this, picture quality amazing, sound, full screen display is very good advantage, connectivity super fast we should install google home for that, most probably I like this TV.. Wait for more ten days for my more reviews..

After 2 weeks usage.
1. Awesome picture quality.
2. Sound is loud,but little bit clarity is missing(Ok).
3. Built-in chromecast is working Fine
4. Checked OTT Apps -prime,netflix,hotstar,Ahaa. All are working Fine.
5.Best budget TV with best features in this price segment.
6. Value for money

I have been using SONY full HD for the past 4 years... Planned to go with Sony again but this product changed my mind to choose this because of the specs... It does what are the things that have told in the specs sheet.. Being a #Rahmaniac (#thalaivARR) fan sound quality is damn good.. Clear voices and great highs and lows.. Mind blowing one... What a great TV to upgrade...
VU u r simply Awesome... Thanks for the great product..

It looks truly premium with the silver bezel less design. The sound quality is really impressive. The interface is quite smooth but it does takes around 5-7 seconds to boot up once you switch on the tv. Android is neatly optimized and screen sharing works perfectly too. The best feature has to be Google Assistant and they have given a dedicated button for it on the remote. It easily detects and responds to our voice. The videos are rich, dynamic and clear. Although, the refresh rate is just 50 hz which is too low for a 4k panel but it serves the basic purpose if clarity is concerned. Its surely a value for money product. It was delivered and installed on the same day with no complaints. Perfect tv for its price!

This is second tv for family. Flipkart delivery was on date and time..even installation n demo was same day within 2 hours at my place that i didn't expected. Tv is soo awesome and feels much premium.. viewing angles r superb on 175 degree..after that it little fade. but who watch tv on 180 degree?....HD & SD channels r running smoothly n SD channels view is also good. bazzels r soo thin..4k content runs superb without lag..sound is very very superb. 30w is very enough for tv. remote need alphanumeric physical buttons so that we can easily change channels by tv remote not by set up box remote. all ports r working and gives their output properly. Value for money.
Thanks.

Not worth buying if you just heard good reviews about it from many people.
If you have a decent budget obviously go for good brands like Sony or Samsung or LG.
Only in the case u lack in budget but want the namesake extra features, then happily go for this one.

The quality is no where close to any other brands in terms or either screen display, sound or even frame rate. Everything just seems so lower in quality than the known brands.

So if u need a TV with good quality display, sound, etc don't think of this one.
Consider only if u are bound by budget and can adjust with close to average performance or below!

In short, I'm not so happy with it! Wish I could just send it back.

Writing this review after 2 months of usage. The Best option out there if you are looking for a budget Smart TV. I have Used MI TV also so I can compare both of them.
In each and every aspect, The Vu Premium TV 4k UltraHd is way ahead of the competition. It gives you the best Picture Quality, Easy Connectivity, Built in Google Assistant for Voice Commands, Easy to Operate Remote with a dedicated shortcut TV button for direct access to your cable or set top box channels (this shortcut not available in other brands) picture added for reference. The Sound Quality is great compared to other brands sound bar not required unless and until you're a loud music freak. I have connected Boat Avante 1200 Sound Bar beacuse I had to purchase it for my MI TV as it was low on sound output. But I rarely use the sound bar while watching TV.
Vu tv comes with a Wall Mount Stand and saves you Rs 500 which is not there with MI TV. Last thing to add, Low Power consumption and Overall Excellent Built Quality.

Highly Recommended This Vu TV to those looking for a good smart TV. Go for it guys and this review is based on my personal usage experience and not influenced by any YouTube channel.

First time bought this Vu brand TV and online though hadn't the first choice brand tv. But the specs sheet is really impressive and earlier models also having good reviews.

1. Picture clarity is really good with HDR and crisp. 5/5
2. Sound is a bit average. would be good if speakers are front-facing like cinema TV (voice has good clarity rather than music) 4/5
3. Connectivity is well responsive. (except casting lags) 3.5/5
4. And booting time is a bit laggy. (as expected in Android)
5. In the segment of 4K tv's price is reasonable with 2GB RAM & 16GB ROM
6. Extended warranty (3 yrs) is given by Vu tv itself with fee compare to Flipkart's complete protection (third party) it is owned and service by Vu TV.

Hope Android updates will be periodical update the TV and life span shud be at least 4 years. And Flipkart rep has been agreed to give complete protecting scheme even after purchasing TV but they refused later by saying as ''Miscommunicated'' Poor policy

Good to extend the warranty to Vu tv itself. Complete satisfaction of Product

But when I put new batteries, it works perfectly. I can't find the reason. Otherwise everything is good.

Pretty Good in terms of everything, be it playing 4k videos, upscaling low quality videos , built in Chromecast and prime, so no need to shell out more money on firestick or Chromecast. However, if you are totally into features and free aps , then you can go for mi 4k TV's, but you need to compromise on picture quality and premium feel of clean Android OS.
I opted for vu TV's because they are dealing with TV's only for a decade, not in other products like mi, lg or samsung , so they can easily focus on quality and industry standards.
Good product, nice experience

Great product, product got delivered on time and installed in 48 hrs from Delivery. Technician came and just opened the box, he did table mount installation outside my flat, I did not allowed technician in my home due to Covid Pandemic situation. Picture quality is excellent but you should have high speed internet otherwise you cannot see picture clearly. I always like external sound system rather than TV inbuilt, so I don't care about sound system but it is good. Also taken 2 year extended warranty from Jeeves.
I had good Experince with Jeeves insurance for mobiles.

Review based on last one week of usage.

100% used for watching online content (prime,hotstar,zee plus, Jio TV and Youtube). Since not taken Netflix membership, not used that.

Anything above 720P or above giving me very good results. Few web serious watched over prime was mind blowing(1080p). Surprisingly it is at par with my brother's LG oled TV ,which is almost 130000.(I watched web serious "The last ship" through both and made the comparison)

Trust me if you have very good broadband wifi connection ,it will give you amazing results. Using your phone's hotspot also good but if you are watching more online content I recommend to get you a good net connection.

Overall I think upto around Rs.50000 if you are looking for a purchase this will do the trick.

Sound is okay. No issues when you are watching in a 12 feet room. Good vocal clarity. When it compares to Mi TV it is far better. Pls don't expect bass from any led tv speakers,for that you must get additional sound woofer.

Remote's four direction button placement is not good. I always accidentally touch other buttons and ended up with going to home screen. I watched almost all reviews of all TV's and i bought this VU 55". Here are my findings.

*Bigger the size better, but upscaling should be good bcoz not all videos you are going to watch are 4k or fullhd. Vu upscaling is good.

*It's better to go for Android TV than Samsung or LG OS. Coz u get so much freedom in usage and more than enough apps. U don't need dish/cable/settopbox/firetvstick.

*Its better if u don't install games in TV. Use TV as screen and connect a console or pc for gaming.

*All Led TV's have less life span compared to plasma or lcd or crt TV. Can't do anything. Take extended warranty for peace of mind. Mostly led panel gets damaged due to lightning and surge.

*I avoided all Chinese brands. Also Mi TV has poor clarity. OnePlus is way too expensive. TCL will get damaged soon. VU is Indian.

*Vu is the best TV right now. Its been 1 month. I found no cons in this TV. Price is also way too less.

*Place the TV straight to your eye. When u sit your eyes should be going right before the centre of TV. Universal law for Viewing distance= size of TV x 1.5
Ex: 55x1.5= around 6 feet.

First of all picture quality of the pannel is too good for this price point. It is a descent pannel with good color reproduction and very bright backlight. The speakers provide good quality output with a reasonable base frequecy. Surround sound effect brings the bass but you won't be able to hear the vocals clearly. You may feel uncomfortable with the sound settings for the first time. Background music will always be in a higher volume than the vocals even if we enable dialog clarity. Better find a sound setting that suits your room by trial and error method through all the settings. Or if you have a home theatre or soundbar then it will be good. But the TV is so loud that i don't even go above 30 as volume where 100 is the maximum. After a month and half of usage the issues which i faced or facing is whenever you keep idle the set top box for some time and when you turn on the set top box thr TV says weak/no signal. When you restart the TV that solves the problem or sometimes you may have to select the composit TV option from the input selection. There are minor glitches in youtube. Youtube randomly fails to sign in back when we go to home and press youtube button again. You can play almost all 4k yuotube videos without any lag but some videos shows some lag. Connectivity is very good. Connects seamlessly to blutooth headset in my case, wifi and lan. It also connects to 5GHz wifi which is a nice feature. Since the remote controller is a bluetooth based remote the batteries won't last as you see in normal TV's. Overall it is a great value for money. Dont expect too much from the play store. My overall rating is 4 on 5.

After a year of usage, the tv pannel shows a group of dead pixels as dark spots randomly, but after a couple of weeks the spot disappears, again it re appears at a different location and disappears again after some weeks. Feels like burnt pixels.

I am a tech enthusiast and was looking for something good under 70 thousand rupees. After going through many products and their reviews I realized many big brands have inferior quality products at high price due to brand value.
But these companies like VU,MI,TCL were providing good on-paper specifications for the price. I was having doubts before buying as I looked at negative reviews thoroughly. It was like a gamble I took. They had 10 day return or exchange policy so I took the gamble. And it was worth it. I am not saying those negative reviews are fake, I think they are just bad luck. But there is warranty and return policy so it's a benefit.

One con I find is, if your room has sunlight coming, there will be reflections on dark scenes so consider having curtains.

Sound is good not the best, I don't require sound bar, it is loud and clear enough for one room. Enabling "Surround sound" makes the sound feel like coming from all over the room even with just stereo TV speakers. I don't disable it now ;) .
You may require sound bar if you have a big hall. Bass is good, speech mode comes handy for dialogue clarity.

I installed ethernet cable for better 4k streaming and it works without buffering. I have 50 mbps plan so considering that.

HDR feel is 8/10. I mean what more do you expect?
HDR clarity is 9.5/10( it is due to 4k resolution, nothing to do with HDR I think).

Viewing angles are excellent for one room, not for a big hall.

I had a VU TV before but it accumulated dust patches inside panel, I had Extended warranty which helped me, I think I will have Extended warranty fir this one too.

Over all a good deal. Wanted to give 4.6 stars but there is option so giving 5.

Everything seems fine but there are some issues with audio.
Following are my concerns
1. ARC irritating
If you are connecting external audio receiver through HDMI ARC you will get better sound but every 5 sec volume level will pop up to your tv display to ruin your viewing experience.

2. TV doesnt gives true dolby digital output
I failed to get sound on my rear speakers. Checked all the settings on TV as well as my pioneer audio receiver.
To test, played some 5.1 test sequences and found that all the audio signals are sent to only front speakers L and R. Connecting external streaming device directly to receiver generates all the signals and you get all of your speakers in action.

Please do not go for this TV , yes this is cheap and with multiple features but it has a very short life and if you still want to go ahead then please do take the service contract at the time of installation you will need that very quickly. In our case we identified the issue of screen Flickering ( names getting tilted) while watching the news channels the bottom lines which reflects names and news all of those were flickering. We raised this concern with VU service team at first they were in denial mode and gave reason like we have issues with out setup box and the cable we are using is not transmitting clearly. Still we pressed for them to come and check so they came and agreed that this TV had an issue. This whole process took a week after a couple of follow ups and call. Post this it came to flipkart's end and arranging for the new TV and getting the replacement done . This was a big lesson learnt for us and will never be ordering such an expensive item from Flipkart again. After breaking my head every day with multiple customer service agents and follow up on social media they made the replacement happen after 20 days on the issue raised. Each customer service agent will ask you to explain the issue from scratch as if they do not see anything in their own system , the social media team will keep on saying sorry for the inconvenience with no intent to get resolution. Please note that Flipkart will never arrange for Un installation it is on the hands of the delivery boy who will come with the new replaced TV to manage the uninstallation process and in that if anything gets damaged then it will your responsibility so please make a video while they do the uninstallation. Again it would be the best decision to not go for this TV if you want peace of mind.

A very well made and beautiful TV. Let's discuss some pros and cons.

Pros:
1. Beautiful picture quality. Amazing colour detection and clarity 10/10
2. Sound is clear and very loud. It seems loud even at 20 mark. Buy a sound bar and you are set for theatre like atmosphere. 10/10
3. Remote is very responsive and of good build quality. But it is slippery, so be careful to jot drop it.
4. Screen to bezel ratio is well thought of and gives us an immersive experience.

Cons:
1. The voice response (microphone) on the remote can be better. It does not capture as well it is expected.
2. Sometimes.. Not often the remote misbehaves and goes a few clicks ahead rapidly.

Other than these no flaws yet. I will update after few months of use. But I will highly recommended you to buy it.

Review after 15 months
Pros
1. High brightness, sharp and good picture.
Iam using below settings
a. By default backlight is set to 100, disable
dynamic backlighting, set it to 45-50(I set it
according to my room light). Viewing tv at 100%
backlight caused me eye strain.
Brightness-50, contrast-50,
color-60, sharpness-1 to 5,
color temperature-low, active contrast- high,
noise reduction- high, digital noise reduction-low

b. It has Dolby digital Plus and its effects are
noticeable. But the dialogs are not loud or
focussed.
Enable trueBassHDX, TruSurroundX, dialog
Clarity. These will give high bass and surround
sound effects

Cons
1. Wifi stopped working after 6 months, after 8
mnths ethernet also not working. Wifi stopped
working after updating android. Lot of people are
complaining about connectivity issues.

2. Sound output is ok. It is not focussed. External
speakers are recommended.

3. Tv remote batteries need to be replaced
frequently. Google voice assistant does not work
properly with remote.

4. We buyed movable wall mount from installation
guy, he charged 2500, but you can get it below
1700 in flipkart.

Product is awesome. Delivery is super awesome. It's delivered and installed within 24hours in a three tier city.

*Delivery:* I personally never have seen this kind of fast and awesome delivery service by E-kart/ Flipkart. I ordered on 5th August 12pm and it got delivered on 6th August 9 AM in a three tier city which is nearly 280km away from Metro city. And it's installed in the same day of delivery.

*Installation:* I am very very happy with the quick service of VU/ Flipkart/ Jeeves. Because it's delivered on 6th August 9 am and received call from Jeeves service centre on 10 am and it got installed on 12PM same day. But the installation guys are not properly aware of the products each options. And there were in hurry in everything. They just wanted to fix it on wall mount and switch it on and wanted to go. They are not likely to give proper demo in casting screen / internet connection. Mobile internet speed was down at that time. They just check once from their mobile and it was not getting connected, so they started insisting to share the OTP (happy code ) of installation to them and let them go as they are having more work. Now my query is only one. How a person who is not aware about smart tv will be aware of the functions if there is no demo given. Flipkart I would like to bring your notice on this.

*Picture quality:* I am using this since last 3 days. The picture quality is awesome. Even when we cast the screen from mobile and play low quality video, it's showing hd types. 4k videos are playing like anything. We got spellbound by this. Picture quality of this tv is way better than MI, Thompson as I have personally checked these brands UHD / 4k tv in friend's house and also it is way better than even Samsung FHD, UHD tv( which are in 30-40k price range ).

*Sound Quality:* It has Dolby audio and sound quality of this tv has having a lot of options. Bass is good, sound quality is good.

*Connectivity:* Internet connectivity from mobile hotspot is quick and it's not lagging. Working very well even when internet speed is low. Casting screen is just a click away from Google home. Awesome connectivity.

*Quality of processor:* 2gb ram, 16gb rom ( 11 gb free at the time of installation). Processor is also fast.

*Look:* It look awesome as it's very thin side strip. It will give pleasure to your eyes I am assuring that. I liked it's style very much. The another plus point is in wall mount it's having enough space to put pendrive, data cable, LAN cable as in back side it's having space to put your hand for using the hdmi options unlike other tv.

*Google assistant:* I only feel there is some lag in Google assistant as it's not working well all the time.

It's been around 9 months since I've bought this TV and I'm absolutely happy with it, especially for the 30k price that I got it for. As for the service, my remote stopped working but the brand sent me a replacement within 4-5 days in the middle of the pandemic, so I'm satisfied in that regard as well. As per my experience, I'm posting a comparison with other TVs in the same range.

Pros:
- 2GB RAM, 16GB ROM. It works like a charm, never had a hiccup in performance. I can install as many apps and games as I like.
- Dolby Vision HDR. Netflix and Disney+ Hotstar support it already, more platforms will in the coming time. This is absolutely gorgeous.
- Dual-band WiFi support. All fiber internet connections support higher speeds on the 5GHz band which is supported here, some other brands don't.
- 4K 60FPS support through the HDMI port if you want to use your laptop to see a movie.
- The speakers are ample loud and of good quality supporting Dolby Audio. There would never be a need for external speakers or soundbars.
- Wakes up from sleep mode super fast, in like 2 seconds.

Cons:
- No MEMC, but that's not a major thing for me.
- No Dolby Atmos support.

Good product

The TV is 100% value for money.

Sound:
Great with plenty of presets and options to get the best experience. It also has a feature TruVolume HD that sort of manages the highs and lows during movies which have loud music but muffled dialogues. You will not have to adjust the volume that frequently thanks to this feature...and can set the volume and forget.

You won't need a separate home theatre system or a sound bar.

Picture:
Crisp. Blacks and whites and overall colours are accurate. There again plenty of customisation settings and has great contrast.

Also, the good part is you can set the picture and sound settings per app and input settings. So if you set a picture and sound setting for say your usual cable / set top box it will stay the same even when you change the settings for another app say YouTube, Prime, Netflix etc. So again you don't have to keep adjusting stuff a lot everytime you switch apps or switch to normal cable TV viewing.

Great upscaling:
Considering this is a 4k TV upscaling is critical. VU does a good job with it too. Upscaling is needed since not every content is 4K. You will be watching a lot of HD content and channels and even SD channels in your day to day use. The upscaling done for such videos and channels is very good. On a 50 inch 4K TV you will not see a lot of blurring or pixelation of SD channels. HD content is no problem at all.

Overall you will get good quality picture in most cases.

UI:
Smooth, fluid and fast.

Remote:
Well thought out. Google Assistant works flawlessly. Has all the buttons you'd need including mute, standby and switching between TV and apps with a single button which a lot other brands tend to skip.

It also has buttons for most common streaming apps - YouTube, Prime, Hotstar, Netflix.

Overall the TV is value for money. The only small con perhaps is the VA panel which is ONLY a problem IF you tend to watch the TV sitting at an extreme angle... Say 160-180 degrees... Which is very very rare.

But you will not find any issue in viewing the TV under normal circumstances.

The great thing about the VA panel is the crispness of the picture and the contrast you get. Much much better than and IPS panel.

Overall if you pick this one over any other TV you won't regret.

Pure value for money.

Its a Value for Money product at 32K price range.
Being an Android Platform, this TV can offer most of the software Bells & Whistles that any other Sony/Samsung/LG flagship TV has to Offer - Though its not fair to weigh it against flagships.

Buy:
You are worried about fast changing tech landscape of Smart TVs, after spending huge bill on a flagships, then this TV is for you.
Keep upgrading the TV every 1-2 years & stay up-to-date with tech trends, without spending huge money - Vu is the Brand in my personal opinion.

Don't Buy:
Unless you keep this TV next to a flagship TV, you will not make out the reasons for shelling huge money on Sony/Samsung/LG.
If you are the kind of person looking for Premium, Perfection & out-and-out Visual Experience then opt for flagships.

This is the review for model 50PM brought by the seller RAMTHRALLA RETAILS for Rs.35k.

The delivery by flipkart was as expected on time.
The installation by Jeeves, as promised was done within 48hours of delivery.(Patience is the key here)

USAGE DURATION - 3 Weeks
ABOUT THE PRODUCT

*Outer Built
- Near bezel-less design. Thick at the bottom. Rest 3 edges are absolutely thin.
- Overall thickness of the TV is less as well.
- It gives a classy look all around.
- The connection slots are at the sides which provides comfortable access.
- The stands are metallic and sturdy.

*Picture Quality
- Undoubtedly this VU meets it's standards as promised.
- The picture quality is excellent. It stands with the competition against high end TVs from Sony/LG/Samsung.
- SD channels definitely show low standards quality but the HD channels/HD Videos from YouTube and other apps are crystal clear.
- Colours are bright with sufficient backlight.(I use it at less than 50%)
- The blacks are true deep blacks.
- No complaints of any colour leakage aur LED panel issue.

*Audio Quality
- The sounds are rich and provides the quality according to the mode set in such as theatre/live/sports/etc
- The only setback here is the overall sound volume is low which is felt when any Bluetooth device is connected as the sound output.

*Connectivity
- HDMI ports. One of them with ARC connectivity.
- Seamless connection to wi-fi.
- BLUETOOTH SOUND OUTPUT HAS A LAG.

*User Interface
- Android 9.0 OS is smooth with sufficient RAM.
- Easy and smooth operation.

* TV Remote
- Connects with Bluetooth.
- Has Google Assistant key with a mic.
- Separate keys for Hotstar/Prime/Netflix.
- No idea about the battery usage yet.

Overall the TV is best in line with the price it requires.
Had compared with other TVs such as Nokia/Mi/Motorola, but I find this one the suitable budget TV currently in market.

* Had purchased 2 years extended warranty from Jeeves along with the order.

Thank you.

29.04.2021
After using it for more than 6 months, I want to say that the tv is working fine, no complain till now. But battery consumption of the tv remote is terrible. Batteries (2 nos.) do not work after one month. Every month I need change the batteries. This is terrible. With new batteries the remote works properly. No complaints with new batteries.

Picture quality is based on the source of the content you view. You cant expect 80s movie to be in 4k quality in this TV.
Expect Google assistant to search content only in You Tube, so don't think it will give answers like Alexa.
As you load more apps, expect a delay in starting the TV for the first time.
Sound quality is good, when you change from theater to music to sports to late night you will feel the difference. Wall mount sound setting definitely helps when your TV is wall mounted.
We have to talk about the size of the TV which is simply amazing, you get theater experience when you play movies with good sound.
Audio only mode is added advantage.
Buy it with offer and get 2 additional year warranty from the money you save. I planned in such a way using my credit card billing cycle did not take EMI but paid in 3 installments, so saved paying interest (food for thought).

Here are some genuine Pros and Cons about this VU Premium 2020 Mode after using for a week.

PROS:
Superfast Delivery and Installation by Flipkart (Got Delivery within 2 days and installation was done on next day by 9AM)

It is a full fledged Android TV with decent configurations and Android 9.0 which works well, I didn’t find any major glitches, minor glitches I will mention in Cons.
On paper specifications are visible on end product as well,Dolby Vision,Dolby Atmos,HLG and DHR 10 features can be felt only when you watch content in Netflix.You can’t notice it while watching HD content from your DTH or streaming others OTT applications.

Picture clarity in DTH looks decent in HD Channels I won’t say it looks great.

Sound output is good, it’s loud and clear. But you have do some settings in audio to get best of it.

Build Quality is Decent

The hot keys and google assistant buttons given in the remote works great though the quality of remote is very poor.

Apps optimisation in OS is just ok, Not that great. Previously I was using a non Smart TV with FireStick and I did not find any noticeable difference in navigating apps and it’s interface. Android have work on its optimisation.

One of the main reason behind my purchase was Android OS where you can install plenty of apps,games,and there is an option to sideload some apps which are not available in play store which i feel is the biggest advantage of an Android TV.
You cant find such flexibility in Tizen or WebOS.
So,Overall it is a good value for money product with good Picture,Sound,Connectivity,and specifications.

CONS:
Remote Quality is Bad, the buttons I don’t think will last more than 6 months. It makes annoying sound while clicking,I just hate that sound.
I got fitted it in my Living Room (Hall), and the viewing angles of this VA Panel is not so good,especially from corners are not that good, pictures looks washed out and faded from sides. Pictures look great only if you sit in front of the TV.
After Sales service of Vu is not that great,service network is poor,hope they will increase the service centres in future.
Prime vidoes lags a bit and takes little extra time to load. Sometimes TV freezes while navigating the apps on home screen hope they’ll fix with an update.

I'm giving this review after 3-4months of usage. This tv is the best in its price range it offers fully fleged Android TV experience.
The things that I don't like about this tv :-

*The display is great when it is in a lit environment , at night I noticed backlight bleeding on the sides even though it is said a direct led lit panel.

*The built in Chromecast is useful just for viewing images and 720p low quality videos. If you want to play 4k or 1080p videos from your phone you have to do it via DLNA (BubbleUpNp) which takes a lot of time to understand.

*The usb ports are working fine but one time a port wasnot working and I was about to return then I tried to format it and it worked i don't know the reliability on a long run.

Upgrade your TV cable connection to HD because SD channel look way better on a HD set topbox eventhough you don't have hd channels
I actually don't know the reliability of this product on a long run. I recommend you to buy a stabilizer just to be safe.

All in all a good purchase. Satisfactory buy :)

1. Picture quality at this price is very good with almost 95% colour gamut . Only problem is display has dark navy blue tint while blacks in picture are deep (perfect display quality with 55 inch TV requires 75k budget).
2. Sound quality with in build speaker (15 X 2 i.e. 30W) is average but give all the desired output via external speakers Dolby, DTS etc works well but you need branded speakers with such audio support.
3. Connectivity - there is a sound lag vs picture with HDMI input and bluetooth output. Similar problem faced with MI TV.
But almost every kind connection ports are available required for home entertainment purposes.
4. Gaming is good over this TV.

The display is A+ grade VA panel with is better then many IPS displays in my opinion...

1. Picture Quality: The best. Tried 4k Video. Looks cristal clear. Viewing angle also very good.

2.sound Quality : Down firing speaker reflects at the bottom. Speeches are not clear as I used local sd set top box.

3. Connectivity : Used only mobile Wi Fi. And the same is running smoothly. Google chromecast sometime lags while mirroring through mobile network(Jio 4G). Still not tried HDMI or optical port.

4. Looks : The looks are classy with thin bezels and slim width. However the Table top stand should be made of metal.

5.Value for Money: Vu should sell the product at fixed price. But they are increasing the same due to high demand. Bought an extra 1k price. Still it is a value for money.
